strings.Value: "What will you do when we win?"
"Will you help me in the battle with the Lantern King?"
"I see you've made peace with Evindra..."
"Did you figure out what we learned from the Eldest?"
"So strange. We've been through more than many have in ages, but we've barely ever... talked." {n}Nyrissa's soft smile lights up her face like the springtime sun.{/n}
"It pains me to see the wound that the curse has left on your soul. Oh, how I wish it were my burden alone..."

"And my poor {d|c41 Good Sister}sister{/d}..." {n}Nyrissa stops for a while. It's obviously hard for her to talk about it.{/n} "I hope our victory over the curse will somehow heal her too. I know I caused harm to thousands of thousands of innocents in {g|Golarion}Golarion{/g}. I ravaged many lives, even your robin bard — and the guilt burns my heart. But I don't regret anything so much as what I did to my sisters — those who followed me into exile and were ready to share all my pains..."
"My grumpy cousin..." {n}Nyrissa says with both bitterness and tenderness in her voice.{/n} "She'd never leave me in trouble. She would run to my rescue, scolding me the whole time!"
"Of course. I would never abandon you."

"I'm not looking that far ahead. But you know... I don't want to go back to {g|First World}the First World{/g} — not at all. I'd rather stay here, in the {g|Stolen Lands}Stolen Lands{/g}, and help heal the wounds I've made. Let my power serve what it was supposed to — creation, joy, and spring.
Besides," {n}Nyrissa whispers,{/n} "there's someone here I don't want to part with."
"Take care. And come back to me..."
"I hope so, and I'm preparing for the final battle and what will follow. The {g|Eldest}Eldest{/g} put weapons in our hands. Now we just have to use them."
